alert.note: Alert for Morris; Sussex (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 2:38PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Morris and central Sussex Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 238 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ogdensburg, or 7 miles east of Newton, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hopatcong, Kinnelon, Butler, Franklin, Riverdale, Hamburg, Ogdensburg, Lake Mohawk, Green Pond and Highland Lake. This includes Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 53 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
